law.text:
// EFFECTIVE UNTIL SEPTEMBER 30, 2013 PER CHAPTER 451 OF 2012 //
A certification by a warrant official to the Comptroller shall include:
the full name and address of the individual and any other names known to be used by the individual;
the Social Security number or federal tax identification number; and
a statement that the warrant is outstanding.
The Comptroller shall determine if an individual for whom a certification is received is due a refund.
As to any individual due a refund for whom a certification is received, the Comptroller shall:
withhold the individual's refund; and
notify the individual of a certification by the warrant official of the existence of an outstanding warrant.
The Comptroller may not pay a refund until the warrant official notifies the Comptroller that the warrant is no longer outstanding.
